data.title: BBS: A Documentary: Other Documentaries
data.text:
The story of Linux and the people behind it. I haven't seen it, but those stills look great. The movie is currently being shown on Finnish television and film festivals.

THE STORY OF COMPUTER GRAPHICS

(60mins, 1999) Directed by Frank Foster

Official Website

An overview of the dawn of computer graphics to the cutting edge of 1999. Created by SIGGRAPH, the top computer graphics organization, the film traces the roots of graphics from the early experiments of the 1950's and up through the breakthroughs of the 1970's and 1980's. Interviews with all sorts of important figures abound.

UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS

(38mins, 1995) Directed by Tourqie (Annaliza Savage)

Official Website View this Film

I have not personally seen this film, years in the making and featuring some of the "big names" (as considered by a spate of books) of the more known hackers of the early 1990's (some of them having gotten fame in the 1980's). I'm sure it'll show up eventually, however.

ONCE UPON ATARI

(4 Episodes, 1999-2000) Directed by Howard Scott Warshaw

Official Website

Howard Scott Warshaw, programmer of the Atari 2600 games "Yars Revenge" and "E.T." has put together a four-episode series about his days at Atari. He's interviewed dozens of folks who did work on the Atari 2600 and worked at the company.

UNFINISHED OR IN PRODUCTION DOCUMENTARIES

OH KAY, COMPUTER

(In Production) from Monkeyhouse Productions

Official Website

A Documentary on the life of Kay McNulty Mauchly Antonelli, a pioneer in the creation of the electronic computer.

GAMERS

(In Production) Directed by Katherine Anna King

Official Website and Trailer

Large (6 episodes) series of documentaries about the computer gaming culture. Looks like it tells the story from the point of view of developers, producers, and the gamers themselves. Looks quite professional.

FRAG: THE MOVIE

(In Production) from Butterdish Studios

Official Website
